reviewText: We've heard from Elinor Donahue and Lauren Chapin on previous FKB releases, but not from Billy Gray (Bud). Mr. Gray wrote me an email a few months ago stating that he'd be happy to do commentary on some episodes. Apparently, he hasn't been asked. My question for Shout Factory is: Why not??? I would love to hear Mr. Gray's perspective and memories of the show!
summary: Why no commentary from Billy Gray?

reviewText: I know, I know.  It's silly to think life was better in those days.  Or is it?  No matter.  This wonderful show still does it for me.  I watched and loved it as a child, as a teenager, and as an adult.  It teaches beautiful lessons, no matter how old-fashioned.  And it can still elicit a good-sized laugh from me, and a tear.  Highly recommend all seasons of this terrific show.
summary: The Way We Should All Be

reviewText: Series Four continues to be great viewing with excellent storylines all well acted by the cast who continue to work effortlessly with each other.  Betty, the eldest daughter evolves into a real obnoxious self obsessive bitch. Jim and Margaret seem to hope that she'll grow out it but instead of improving her personality is getting steadily worse. She is still dragging around her handbag boyfriend Ralph whilst going out with just about every other boy in Springfield.  She is revolting to her cousin Milly.  If she were my daughter - I'd be so ashamed !  It's fascinating though to watch, there is a lot of psychological sub text to Betty that is played very close to the surface - Elinor Donahue does well.  I wonder, is Ralph really a closet Gay and Betty consequently sexually frustrated ?  Bud is growing up but still has no brains in the romance department either.  Bring on the next series and by the way - How many series are there ?

reviewText: Father Knows Best is one of those rare TV shows where the series gets better each succeeding season.  In season 4, all the scripts are top-notch, the direction and photography are amazing, the acting superb, the music just right: they have the format down to a "t" to tug at your emotions.  You'll laugh, cry a little, learn something, and in the end, wish you were a member of the Anderson Family.  ShoutFactory did an amazing job with this season's set.  They attached the correct season 4 opening credits to the episodes, and even though Sony-Screen Gems no longer has rights or interests in this series, they left in the "screen gems logo" at the end, the way us fans remember it, THANKS!  The quality is great (on my 52" HDTV), the sound amazing for a 50 year old show.  All episodes are uncut, running 25 1/2 minutes, about 4 minutes longer than you used to see when the series ran on the CBN Family Channel in the 80s and 90s.  There are also some episodes not broadcast in a long time, Mr. Beal Meets His Match, is an example, once thought to be lost. You'll love this season, I recommend it highly.

reviewText: Yes, Shout Factory decided to cross the bridge and release Father Knows Best season four!  They didnt stop at season three like SONY or Warner Bros. might have.  The next three seasons truly have the best episodes.  The much talked about MR. BEALS episode is odd, spooky and ultimately satisfying.  It scared me as a kid and still does now.  You wouldn't see storyline like this on say My Three Sons or Ozzie and Harriett.  For dog lovers there is A Friend In Need with its heart-tugging conclusion.  When Margaret inherits a house to rent out she runs into a nasty spat with her neighbor, and his rosebushes, in the episode The Good Neighbor.  Again Shout Factory goes the extra mile with clear, pristine and UNCUT transfers.  Plus bonus segments from Robert Youngs' next series, Window on Main Street, two episodes!  One final note-I can't say that I remember Bettys' character being so mean and selfish as she is in season four.  Elinor Donahue plays the part to the hilt.  This is one good buy!
